Posts.Content: Mamacat1 wrote: Hi, I'm new here. I' m 47 years old and I'm really scared. I had a mammogram two weeks ago and they had me come back in for a second one last week. After the mammogram, they needed to do an ultrasound as well. The radiologist said he found a "mass" in my left breast and some calcification in my right breast. They scheduled a ultrasound guided biopsy for my left breast and a stereotactic biopsy in my right breast. The radiologist was very vague about both procedures, but I've looked on the Internet and found some information about it. Can anyone tell me a little more about these procedures? I think the waiting is the worst part of this. Several years ago, my doctor told me I have fibrocystic breasts. Would this make any difference? Thanks! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Scared Mamacat1 Mamacat1

Posts.Content: May 19, 2013 12:35PM Mamacat1 wrote: Thanks! That' s great advice--After I googled these, I had more concerns than ever. I won't do that again. I guess now I'll just wait and try not to panic.
